creator: Omnis@EssexSystems.com
text:
The follwing configuration: 

"./configure" \
"--enable-layout=Solaris9-LOU" \
"--enable-mods-shared=all" \
"--enable-ssl=shared" \
"--enable-auth-digest" \
"--enable-example" \
"--enable-cern-meta" \
"--enable-expires" \
"--enable-headers" \
"--enable-ldap" \
"--with-ldap-dir=/usr/iplanet" \
"--enable-auth-ldap" \
"--enable-usertrack" \
"--enable-unique-id" \
"--with-perl=/usr/perl5/bin/perl" \
"--enable-optional-hook-export" \
"--enable-optional-hook-importer" \
"--enable-optional-fn-import" \
"--enable-optional-fn-export" \
"--enable-dav" \
"--enable-dav-fs" \
"--with-mpm=prefork" \
"--enable-rule=EAPI" \
"--enable-suexec" \

- CONFIGURES withour error.  However, the 'make' command returns:

(...)

`/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/modules/aaa'
Building shared: mod_access.la mod_auth.la mod_auth_anon.la mod_auth_dbm.la
mod_auth_digest.la

/bin/bash /usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/srclib/apr/libtool --silent
--mode=compile gcc  -g -O2 -pthreads    -DSOLARIS2=9 -D_POSIX_PTHREAD_SEMANTICS
-D_REENTRANT -DAP_HAVE_DESIGNATED_INITIALIZER  
-I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/srclib/apr/include
-I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/srclib/apr-util/include
-I/usr/local/include -I. -I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/os/unix
-I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/server/mpm/prefork
-I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/modules/http
-I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/modules/filters
-I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/modules/proxy
-I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/include
-I/usr/local/ssl/include/openssl -I/usr/local/ssl/include
-I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/modules/dav/main -prefer-pic -c
mod_access.c && touch mod_access.slo
/bin/bash /usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/srclib/apr/libtool --silent
--mode=link gcc  -g -O2 -pthreads    -DSOLARIS2=9 -D_POSIX_PTHREAD_SEMANTICS
-D_REENTRANT -DAP_HAVE_DESIGNATED_INITIALIZER  
-I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/srclib/apr/include
-I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/srclib/apr-util/include
-I/usr/local/include -I. -I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/os/unix
-I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/server/mpm/prefork
-I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/modules/http
-I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/modules/filters
-I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/modules/proxy
-I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/include
-I/usr/local/ssl/include/openssl -I/usr/local/ssl/include
-I/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/modules/dav/main -export-dynamic
-L/usr/local/lib -L/usr/local/ssl/lib -R/usr/local/ssl/lib      -o mod_access.la
-rpath /usr/apache2/libexec -module -avoid-version  mod_access.lo

make[4]: *** [mod_access.la] Error 100
make[4]: Leaving directory
`/usr/c1t0d2/DOWNLOADS/solaris/httpd-2.0.47/modules/aaa'

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
That message isn't from Apache, it is from libtool or gcc or ld
or ar or something else called by "libtool --mode=link gcc"

You can likely see which command failed by running

  make LTFLAGS=' ' 

This will cause libtool to print a message for each of the commands
it issues under the covers.

We aren't going to be able to solve the problem since it is from one 
of the build tools on your system.

Good luck!
